pgTitle: List of United States servicemembers and civilians missing in action during the Vietnam War (1972–75)

rows.text: Killed in action, body not recovered
Rifleman on a UH-1H #69-16717 hit by anti-aircraft fire on a search and rescue mission, crashed and was seen to explode
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons system officer on an F-4D #66-8792 which crashed inverted while pulling up from a bombing run
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of an F-4D which crashed inverted while pulling up from a bombing run
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-7E suffered engine failure and he was seen to eject
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of an HH-53C that crashed on a rescue mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pararescueman on an HH-53C that crashed on a rescue mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of an HH-53C that crashed on a rescue mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pararescueman on an HH-53C that crashed on a rescue mission
Killed in action, body not recovered
Door gunner on UH-1H #67-17841 that was hit by enemy fire and crashed, he was injured and carried on a litter by ARVN troops to a Fire Support Base, but was not seen again
Killed when a rocket hit the radio bunker at FSB Sarge
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed when a rocket hit the radio bunker at FSB Sarge
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of EB-66C #54-0466 call sign Bat 21 hit by an SA-2 missile
Electronic warfare officer on EB-66C #54-0466 call sign Bat 21 hit by an SA-2 missile
Electronic warfare officer on EB-66C #54-0466 call sign Bat 21 hit by an SA-2 missile
Electronic warfare officer on EB-66C #54-0466 call sign Bat 21 hit by an SA-2 missile
Copilot on a UH-1H #68-16330 that crashed in heavy cloud flying from Marble Mountain Air Facility to Quảng Trị City
Door gunner on a UH-1H #68-16330 that crashed in heavy cloud flying from Marble Mountain Air Facility to Quảng Trị City
Pilot of a UH-1H #68-16330 that crashed in heavy cloud flying from Marble Mountain Air Facility to Quảng Trị City
Killed in action, body not recovered
Disappeared evading capture after his position was overrun by NVA

Pilot of an OV-10A #68-3820, call sign Covey 282 hit by anti-aircraft fire, ejected successfully, evaded capture for 11 days, last seen by a search and rescue helicopter with NVA troops closing in around him
Electronic warfare officer on an EA-6A #156979 that disappeared on a night mission
Pilot an EA-6A #156979 that disappeared on a night mission
Pilot of an F-4E hit by ground fire and seen to hit the ground with no objection observed. The remains of the weapons systems office Lt. Clemie McKinney were returned in 1985
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons systems officer on an F-105G hit by anti-aircraft fire and crashed in Haiphong harbour
Pilot of an F-105G hit by anti-aircraft fire and crashed in Haiphong harbour
District senior adviser disappeared while evading capture after the NVA overran Tanh Canh Base Camp
Evacuated by helicopted as NVA overran Tanh Canh Base Camp, the UH-1H #69-15715 was hit by enemy fire and crashed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Copilot of UH-1H #69-15715 was hit by enemy fire while evacuating Tanh Canh Base Camp and crashed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of UH-1H #69-15715 was hit by enemy fire while evacuating Tanh Canh Base Camp and crashed
Killed in action, body not recovered
UH-1H #69-15715 which was hit by enemy fire while evacuating Tanh Canh Base Camp and crashed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Medic on UH-1H #69-15715 which was hit by enemy fire while evacuating Tanh Canh Base Camp and crashed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
CCK Air Force Base on temporary duty to 345th Tactical Airlift Squadron
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of an A-6A #155709 shot down. The remains of the weapons system operator Captain David B. Williams were returned in 1989
His A-7E was hit by an SA-2 while attacking a SAM site, ejected successfully
Pilot of an F-4J #155576 hit by enemy fire while attacking SAM missile transporters, no ejection observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Passenger in an SH-3G helicopter which crashed while landing on USS Providence (CL-82) at night
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of an AH-1G #69-15009 hit by ground fire
Weapons systems officer on an F-4D which disappeared on a night reconnaissance mission over the Ban Karai Pass
Copilot of an AH-1G #67-15836 hit by a SAM and brioke in half at an altitude of 4800 feet. The remains of the pilot W2 Isaac Y. Hosaka were recovered on 5 June
His A-4F #155045 was hit by anti-aircraft fire, no ejection or parachute observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons system officer on an F-4D #66-6232 hit by an SA-2 while on a MigCAP mission near Yên Bái airfield, no ejection or parachutes observed
Crewman on an OH-6A hit by enemy fire
Killed in action, body not recovered
His A-7A was lost while on a night attack mission
Pilot of an A-6A hit by enemy fire and crashed into the ground, no ejection observed
Weapons systems officer on an F-4E which disappeared on an armed reconnaissance mission. The remains of the pilot 1st Lieutenant James L. Huard were identified in 1997
Journalist klled in an NVA ambush
Weapons systems officer on an F-4D
His A-7B #154521 crashed at sea while on a night reconnaissance mission over Nghệ An Province
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
His F-8J crashed on final approach to the carrier at night
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of A-6A #157018 hit by anti-aircraft fire during a low-level night armed reconnaissance/strike mission. The remains of the bombardier/navigator Lt Harry S. Mossman were recovered in 2003

Weapons systems officer on F-4E #68-0477 hit by ground fire on a close air support mission. The wing separated from the aircraft, which rolled inverted and crashed into the ground at a speed of 450 knots. No ejection observed
Killed in action, body not recovered

Pilot of F-4E #68-0477 hit by ground fire on a close air support mission. The wing separated from the aircraft, which rolled inverted and crashed into the ground at a speed of 450 knots. No ejection observed
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons systems officer on an F-4E #64-0335 hit by anti-aircraft fire and possibly collided with an O-1F #2799 forward air controller, two ejections and one parachute observed
Pilot of an O-1F #2799 forward air controller, which apparently collided with F-4E #64-0335
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of an F-4E #64-0335 hit by anti-aircraft fire and possibly collided with an O-1F #2799 forward air controller, two ejections and one parachute observed
His A-7B was hit by lightning and subsequently disappeared on a reconnaissance misison
Bombardier/navigator of an A-6A #157028 shot down on a bombing mission. The remains of the pilot CDR Verne G Donnelly were identified in 1991
Killed in action, body not recovered
Electronic warfare officer on an F-105G # 8360 was hit by an SA-2 and crashed at sea
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of an F-105G # 8360 was hit by an SA-2 and crashed at sea
Killed in action, body not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Observer on an OV-10 #67-14673 that was seen to explode in mid-air while directing naval gunfire
Killed in action, body not recovered
on an OV-10 #67-14673 that was seen to explode in mid-air while directing naval gunfire
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of an A-6A #155700 that disappeared on a bombing mission
Bombardier/navigator on an A-6A #155700 that disappeared on a bombing mission
Bombardier/navigator on an A-6A that crashed on the deck of the USS Midway during a night landing, ejected but not recovered
Killed in action, body not recovered
Weapons systems officer on an F-111A that disappeared on a single aircraft night strike mission
Radar intercept officer of an F-4J hit by anti-aircraft fire, both crewmen ejected but only the pilot was rescued
Weapons systems officer on an F-111A #67-0092 that disappeared on a night strike mission. Aircraft wreckage washed up south of Huế in December
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of an F-111A #67-0092 that disappeared on a night strike mission. Aircraft wreckage washed up south of Huế in December
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of an A-6A Intruder #155622 that crashed following a night launch, the bombardier/navigator ejected successfully
Killed in action, body not recovered
Flight surgeon passenger on an F-4D that crashed on a non-combat flight from Udorn, Thailand to Da Nang
Weapons systems officer on an F-111A #67-099 that disappeared on a single aircraft strike mission
Pilot of an F-111A #67-099 that disappeared on a single aircraft strike mission
Gunner on a B-52D #56-0622 hit by an SA-2, 2 crewmen ejected and were captured, the remains of 2 other crewmen were returned in 2003 and 2004
Pilot of a B-52D #56-0622 hit by an SA-2, 2 crewmen ejected and were captured, the remains of 2 other crewmen were returned in 2003 and 2004
Radar-navigator on a B-52D hit by an SA-2 over Hanoi, all other crewmen ejected successfully
Co-pilot of a B-52D #55-0061 hit by an SA-2, 3 crewmen ejected successfully and were captured, while the remains of the other 2 crewmen were returned in 1989
Pilot of an O-1 FAC that collided with an A-7D during a close air support mission, the O-1 crash-landed and he was seen to be dead
Killed in action, body not recovered
Pilot of an O-1 shot down east of Dong Ha
